definition: too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: He was very ill as a child and was considered delicate thereafter.
sentences.chinese: 他幼年多病，而後一向被人認爲弱不禁風。

sentences.english: In the short-term at least, the most vulnerable countries are all smaller ones.
sentences.chinese: 至少在短期內，小國家纔是最弱不禁風的。

sentences.english: His son is a cream puff. He should exercise more.
sentences.chinese: 他的兒子弱不禁風，應該多“運動”“運動”。

sentences.english: But possession was still being lost too easily and the defence looked vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 但是球權還是被對手太輕鬆搶去，防線看來弱不禁風。

sentences.english: So you have to make things rough for them and weed out the weenie trees early on.
sentences.chinese: 所以你必須磨練它們，儘早淘汰那些弱不禁風的樹。

sentences.english: His thin body looks extremely delicate.
sentences.chinese: 他瘦瘠的身體看起來似乎弱不禁風。

sentences.english: Two years of coddling has resulted in trees that expect to be waited on hand and foot.
sentences.chinese: 兩年的悉心庇護，結果兩棵樹弱不禁風。

definition: to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to rob the rich to help the poor
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
